And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate. But we’ve had no evidence yet that [the change/mutation allowing infection of mammals/birds]’s happened for humans or for pigs.

trace_entries.rationale: Contains plain outcome/process verbs ('occurred', 'emerged', 'seen', 'has changed', 'mutated', 'is infecting', 'have had'). 'at an increasing rate' is rate, not specific scale/impact.

statement_text: If you look at the cases that have occurred since 1997, when it [H5N1] first emerged in human cases in Hong Kong, through to mid-2015 to 2016, those years were by far the highest-risk situation. We’ve seen very few cases in humans since then [mid-2015/2016]. And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate. But we’ve had no evidence yet that [the change/mutation allowing infection of mammals/birds]’s happened for humans or for pigs.

trace_entries.rationale: The segment contains a superlative ('highest-risk') modifying a noun ('situation') and an intensifier ('very') modifying 'few' (a count), not a risk-adjective.

statement_text: If you look at the cases that have occurred since 1997, when it [H5N1] first emerged in human cases in Hong Kong, through to mid-2015 to 2016, those years were by far the highest-risk situation. We’ve seen very few cases in humans since then [mid-2015/2016]. And part of that [the reason for very few human cases] is that the virus has changed—it [the virus]’s mutated to the point of where it is infecting other mammalian species and birds at an increasing rate. But we’ve had no evidence yet that [the change/mutation allowing infection of mammals/birds]’s happened for humans or for pigs.

statement_text: Health officials have been urging dairy workers to wear personal protective equipment [PPE] in milking parlors, for example, given the sky-high levels of virus [H5N1] in cows’ udders and their milk. But milking parlors can be hot and stuffy, meaning it [wearing PPE]’s not comfortable or feasible to wear masks and goggles.
